column4: hey guys can u help me about this http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/26447/
hey guys can u help me about this http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/26447/
why not use the pidgin in the repos?
repos? what is repos? :D
why not use the pidgin that is installed by ubuntu?
cuz it is not the latest version!
I am installing the new version 2.4.3
sorry disconnected! can u help me more?
the newest version is not always the best version. if you want to you can look at the depends that are required and compile them all yourself but that is probably not the best idea
I know! but I want to use it ...

I already told you what to do. you need to upgrade perl libcairo2 libglib2.0-0 libpango1.0-0 libpurple0. which probably have a bunch of they're own depends and if you think all that hassle is worth it then go ahead. personally I would just upgrade the OS and get the latest version Ubuntu offers
Ok I will try it
gordonjcp der|kunstler tnx guys I will try it
you will try compiling all that yourself?
good luck with that :)
yes do a backup first please
you will need to download and compile all the depends for pidgin. you are better off upgrading the OS.
what you are trying to do would be difficult for someone who has many years of linux experience. just upgrade to 8.04
My problem is: I dont know what is the packages I need to install!
can u help me?
package for what?
the problem for install pidgin is perl version, and I want to upgrade my perl! and I don know how

ok let me explain it to you so you understand. please keep in mind that I am not trying to insult you. right now you are not ready or capable of doing such an upgrade of perl. you don't have enough knoledge not to mention that updating perl will probably cause other issues. besides the fact that from your pastebin earlier today you have 6 other depends you need to upgrade that are not yet available in ubuntu. solution do a dist-upgrade to
just because pidgin has released a new version does not mean that it is better then the one provided with Ubuntu 8.04. I really think you need to do an upgrade of Ubuntu and not of pidgin
